name: Adrián Campos
introduction: OccupationFounderExecutive Vice-PresidentEmployerHRTAdrin Campos Suer was a Formula One driver who drove for Minardi in 1987 and 1988. After a racing career which included the 1997 Le Mans 24 Hours, Campos turned to team management, forming the Campos Racing Team.  The team entered GP2 in 2005 before being accepted into F1 for the 2010 season. After suffering financial problems however, the team was sold to Jos Ramn Carabante in February 2010 and was renamed to Hispania Racing. As a result of the takeover, Campos was given the position of "executive vice-president" of the team.
